summary: This is a Victim Notification System (VNS) email from the U.S. Department of Justice, Southern District of New York, notifying a victim identified as 'Jackson' about the criminal case against Ghislaine Maxwell (Case No. 20-CR-00330). It outlines victims' rights under the Crime Victims' Rights Act and provides instructions for accessing case information. The document includes internal FBI email chains discussing a lack of response from prosecutors regarding victim notifications.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Named as the defendant in the criminal case (Case No. 20-CR-00330) for which this victim notification is being sent. The main charge is categorized under Project Safe Childhood.

persons.name: Audrey Strauss
persons.context: Signatory of the victim notification letter from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York.

events.title: Victim Notification for Ghislaine Maxwell Case
events.description: The U.S. Department of Justice Victim Notification System sends a formal notification to a victim identified by law enforcement in the criminal case against Ghislaine Maxwell, informing them of their rights and the status of the prosecution.

locations: One St. Andrews Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: The document is a victim notification related to the federal criminal case against Ghislaine Maxwell (Case No. 20-CR-00330, Docket 20-CR-00330).
The notification is sent to a victim identified by the last name 'Jackson' (Victim ID 3652, PIN 9999).
Internal FBI emails preceding the notification reveal confusion and a lack of response from SDNY prosecutors ('AUSAs') regarding whether victims received letters and what language was used.
The notification outlines the full set of rights afforded to victims under the Crime Victims' Rights Act (18 U.S.C. ยง 3771).
The lead prosecutor's name is redacted in the document, indicated by blank spaces in the text.
